title: Ian Holloway slams 'unprofessional' James Maddison and says midfielder should be 'terrified'
text:
James Maddison is unprofessional, according to Ian Holloway (REX)

Ian Holloway believes James Maddison is ‘unprofessional’ and feels the Leicester City midfielder will be ‘terrified’ about being selected for the next England squad.

Maddison was initially named in Gareth Southgate’s squad for the current international break but was forced to pull out through illness.

The 22-year-old was then spotted in a casino on the same night England lost to Czech Republic in their Euro 2020 qualifier.

‘It’s unbelievably naive, unprofessional as well,’ Holloway told talkSPORT.

‘He’s a young man, so I wouldn’t like to be him at the minute because he’ll be worried about his England career.

Maddison pulled out of England duty through illness (Getty Images)

‘Gareth said he knows everything about them [the players], he only wants the good ones.

‘I think he’s ruthless, if you don’t play well you won’t be in the team.

‘He’s a very good player but it’s not just about being a very good player, you’ve got to be a very good person.

‘But how proud am I of these boys at the moment, Tyrone Mings making his debut was strong enough, Raheem Sterling at the minute is unbelievable, Marcus Rashford… the way they are behaving, I’m delighted, I’m not embarrassed.

‘If I were Maddi this morning I’d have a right good think about where I’m going and what I’m doing.

‘Bad habits, get out of them.’

Asked if he is in danger of not getting back in the England squad, Holloway replied: ‘I would definitely think so. I would have been terrified.’
